original: NYLANDER, Oscar Erik, Landshövding, Visby, f Linkp 30/1 85 av byggm O N o Sigrid Ågren, gm Anna Eriksson. Utl stud 05, fil kand Upps 08. Sekr Sv allm exp.frn 09, hdlsattaché v beskickn i Konstantinopel 11, dir.ass Sv allm exp.frn 15, vkst dir 15—41, Ihövd på Gotl sed. 41. Led Sthlms stads fri-hamnskomm 16, frihamnsnmdn 17, stdflm 17 —19, komm f omorg av utr.dep, komm f kommers inform.väs, sv hj.kred.komm, sakk i komm f omarb av jvgstraf.stadg, f utredn betr turistreklam o utl resebyråverksamh, f utredn betr Sv diplom.repr i Central- o Sydamer, led av isbrytarkomm, utr.dep :s an-tagn.komm, Gbgsutst:s styr o exp.utsk 23, styr o arb.utsk f Sv delt i Rio de Janeiro-utst 22, d:o Barcelona-utst 29 o utst i Bryss 35, deleg v sv-tyska hdlstraktatförh 26 o 32, d :o v hdlsavt.förh m Polen 33, Ital 35, v tullfreds-konf i Geneve 30, led 32 års hdlskomni, trak-tatberedn 32, exp.kred.nmdn 33, clearingsnnidri 34—41, kulturrådet 35, led av 38 års exp.utredn, stat reservförrådsnmd 39—41, stat hdlskom-miss 39—41, styr.led valutakont 40, ordf Gotl l hush.sällsk 41. 2:a kamm (h, bev.utsk, ut-rikesnmdn) 18—41. Av trycket: Exporttekn (11), Levantens hdlsförhåll (15), På kommersiell studiefärd i Sydamer (29). KVOlkl, RNO, StOffBLeopII :sO, StOffLettSO, StOff RumSO, KFinlVROlkl, KItKrO, KNS:tOO, KPolRest-2kl, KSpICO, TM03kl, KÖHT, RDDO, RFrHL.
translated: NYLANDER, Oscar Erik, County Governor, Visby, b. Linköping 30/1 1885, son of builder O.N. and Sigrid Ågren, m. Anna Eriksson. Studied abroad in 1905, received a Bachelor's degree from Uppsala University in 1908. Secretary at the Swedish General Export Association from 1909, Commercial Attaché at the embassy in Constantinople in 1911, Director Assistant at the Swedish General Export Association from 1915, Director of Commerce and Industry from 1915 to 1941, County Governor of Gotland since 1941. Member of the Stockholm City Free Port Commission from 1916, Free Port Board from 1917, Stockholm City Board from 1917 to 1919, Committee Member and Secretary at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs, Commerce, Commercial Information Section, Swedish Credit Committee, Expert in Committee for Revision of Railway Traffic Regulations, Expert in Committee for Tourism Advertising and Foreign Travel Agency Activities, Expert in Committee for Swedish Diplomatic Representation in Central and South America, Member of the Icebreaker Committee, Appointed Committee by the Ministry for Foreign Affairs, Board and Export Committee for Gothenburg Exhibition in 1923, Board and Working Committee for Swedish Participation in Rio de Janeiro Exhibition in 1922, Barcelona Exhibition in 1929 and Brussels Exhibition in 1935, Delegate to Swedish-German Trade Treaty Negotiations in 1926 and 1932, Trade Agreement Negotiations with Poland in 1933, Italy in 1935, Participated in Customs Peace Conference in Geneva in 1930, Member of the Trade Committee in 1932, Treaty Committee in 1932, Export Credit Board in 1933, Clearing Inquiry in 1934-1941, Cultural Council in 1935, Member of the Export Inquiry of 1938, State Reserve Supply Committee from 1939 to 1941, State Trade Commissioner from 1939 to 1941, Board Leader of the Currency Control in 1940, Chairman of the Gotland County Agricultural Society in 1941. Member of the Second Chamber (Conservative Party), Military Affairs Committee, Foreign Affairs Committee from 1918 to 1941. Published works: "Export Technique" (1911), "Trade Relations in the Levant" (1915), "On a Commercial Study Trip in South America" (1929). Received the Royal Order of the Sword, Knight 1st Class, Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Officer, Order of the Polar Star, Commander of the Finnish Order of the White Rose, Knight, Knight of the Italian Order of the Crown, Officer, Royal Order of Vasa, Knight 2nd Class, Royal Order of St. James of the Sword, Commander, Turkish Order of Medjidie, 3rd Class, Honorary Member of the Royal Academy of Agriculture and Forestry, Royal Belgian Order of Leopold II, Officer, Russian Order of St. Stanislaus, 2nd Class, Russian Order of St. Anna, 2nd Class, French Red Cross Medal.
